info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 30 at 12:43AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Rutherford, southern Cleveland, southern Gaston, northwestern Laurens, east central Greenville, northwestern York, Spartanburg, north central Anderson, Cherokee, east central Pickens and northwestern Union Counties through 130 AM EST... At 1243 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Forest City to 10 miles west of Spartanburg to near Easley. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gastonia, Greenville Downtown, Spartanburg, Gaffney, Shelby, Easley, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer and Mauldin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 AM EST for Upstate South Carolina.
